H0.text: Community is the type of group that all populations living in the same area make up, and it includes populations of different organisms.

H1.text: Environment is the type of group that comprises all populations that live in the same area, including populations of different organisms.

H2.text: A colony is the type of group that consists of all populations that live in the same area and includes populations of different organisms.

H3.text: A hive is a type of group that includes all of the populations that live in the same area and consists of populations of different organisms.

A4.text: In ecology, a community is a group or association of populations of two or more different species occupying the same geographical area at the same time

A5.text: The term community has a variety of uses. In its simplest form it refers to groups of organisms in a specific place or time, for example, 'the fish community of Lake Ontario before industrialization'
